# endEvents

**Instance Property**

The events associated with the end of scene represented by this trigger.

## Declaration

```swift
var endEvents: [HMEvent] { get }
```

## Discussion

HomeKit restores the previously active scene when the events in this array trigger. For example, you can use end events to execute a scene for 10 minutes by specifying an [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMDurationEvent] in the list of [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMEventTrigger/endEvents]. This restores the previous scene when the duration event triggers.

You can also use [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristicEvent] and [doc://com.apple.homekit/documentation/HomeKit/HMCharacteristicThresholdRangeEvent] objects as end events.

## Restoring the previous scene after an event

- **updateEndEvents(_:completionHandler:)**: Updates the set of end events associated with the event trigger.
